metadata.title: Less is More; the ‘Art’ of Sampling | Towards Data Science
metadata.h1: Less is More; the ‘Art’ of Sampling (Stat-01)
metadata.description: Sample and Population. | A guide on how to sample vast data sets. Optimum sample from the population leads a data scientist in the right direction.

outgoing_paragraph_urls.anchor_text: Find the updated statistics of coronavirus.

all_paragraphs: “It is the mark of a truly intelligent person to be moved by statistics.”

Today's world is driven by data science. In every spare of life, we are using data science. It is an integral part of Machine Learning, IoT, Big Data, etc. Behind the scene, statistics drive all of these. It is the brain of the modern techniques. If you are moved by statistics, it’s easy for you to make wise decisions. A statistical decision can also backfire your system if you are not an expert statistician. The sample is an essential element of statistics, which guides data scientists to analyze the whole topics more easily and effectively. Most often, it is almost impossible for a large data set to be processed and this is where a sample makes things… happen!

“I think it’s being innovative and very creative to stay away from flat-out sampling somebody else’s record. To me, that doesn’t show too much of your creative side unless you take a little piece and add it, almost like spice on a chicken”-Missy Elliott.

A perfect quote to be followed to create an optimum sample for a better model. We must be creative in the case of sampling. But how? No worries, I will help you to make your spicy chicken with sampling as Missy said. Just follow me.
Statistics/mathematics is not boring, it's fun, try to relate yourself and nature with it. Now, let me guide you through.

In data science, basic statistics is used. Most often, tiny topics like sampling technique are not taken into account by the data scientists. But it could be a vital issue for the data-driven approach. We will discuss the following sections:
The whole world takes a rest with the outbreak of the corona pandemic. Even the world still does not know how to behave with the pandemic.

At November-17,2019, the first person was affected by coronavirus[1]. The medical specialist considered the case as pneumonia as it was not seen before. This virus spread out geometrically. And within a month, the virus affected many people. On 31 December 2019, WHO was informed of a cluster of cases of pneumonia of unknown cause detected in Wuhan City, Hubei Province of China[2]. Now, the cases are increasing dramatically. According to WHO, statistics of the current situation is shown below.
Find the updated statistics of coronavirus.

Here, the knowledge of statistics comes in. At the beginning of the stage, the corona cases were a small number. Anyone could easily analyze the cases individually. What if when it turns into an epidemic! When the area of occurrence will become large, it goes beyond our capacity to analyze the individual case. Then what will we do in these circumstances? Will we give up? Not at all.

For instance, we asked a data scientist to help us out there. And told him to find out the death rate of the coronavirus affected people. Then he requested us to collect the data of 300 confirmed cases. He also added, “These 300 cases are enough to know the behavior of all the corona cases.” These 300 cases are the sample of the overall affected people in the world. If we consider all the 234073 confirmed cases (confirmed total), this sample will turn into a population. So, the population defines all the data of a specific case. The concept of sample and population may change if we change the question. How? Seems confusing!

Whether a group of data is a sample or a population depends on what kind of question we are trying to answer. The image depicts that the total number of coronavirus confirmed cases is 234073 in the world. If we try to find out whether the people of the world are affected by the coronavirus, then group formed by 234073 coronavirus affected people is a population. Because the total number of coronavirus affected people is 234073. On the other hand, if we try to find out whether the people of the world are affected by any virus, then the group formed by 234073 people is a sample. Because there are many viruses in the world and coronavirus is one of them.
Each object/case of a population/ sample is known as unit/point/event.
Selection of elements for a sample from the population either random or selective.
Let us assume, two samples of confirmed corona case.

We may find the death rate for two different samples as shown above. In each sample, we get a different death rate. And the death rate of the population is the desired death rate. Then which sample is better? How do we measure? Get puzzled!
The best sample is representative of the population result. WHO estimates the death rate of 3.4% till 3 March 2020[3]. Assume it is our population result of the death rate.
The result is a little bit diverse from the sample result. It is called the sampling error.
Sampling error=(Population result — Sample result)
A successful statistical model largely depended on optimum sampling. The more you will be creative in sampling, the more your model be accurate (representative to the population).
A sample (good sample) represents the population when Sampling Error is minimum. To do so we need to select the sample randomly.
Now, we are jumping to a real-world example with the WNBA Player Stats Season 2016–17 dataset. You can also find documentation of the column here.
Suppose, we are asked to find the average point of the players with optimum sampling. Let’s start with our creativity to find the optimum answer.

There are data of 143 players in the WNBA Player Stats Season 2016–17 dataset. We are taking 10 sample data randomly for 150 times for analyzing the average points of the players. The output will be something like below.

With only 10 individual data, the statistical model is not always providing a representative sample. Because some of the samples’ average points are much higher or lower than the population’s average point. It is not desirable. Let’s step on.
When we increase the sample size, our sample becomes more representative of the population. Let’s get more visual intuition with the WNBA Player Stats Season 2016–17 dataset.

When the sample size is 100 all of the random sample is highly representative of the dataset and each increment of sample size makes the random sample more representative. So, we should keep it in our minds while sampling.
There are 5 types of players in the dataset. If we observe the column ‘Pos’ of the WNBA Player Stats Season 2016–17 dataset, we will find the following types of players.
Only random sample selection may select some players which won’t contain all 5 types of players. It may lead to a poor representative sample model. We can stratify all the 5 types of players.

We can pick an equal number of players from each stratum(each stratified group is known as stratum) to make a sample. The best choice is to select the element proportionally. And this strategy is known as proportional stratified sampling.
We can also stratify with other parameters. At the final step, we should select the best-stratified sample which provides the best-desired result.

Sometimes, our dataset may not be well organized as like WNBA Player Stats Season 2016–17 dataset. It may be distributed or difficult to collect. In those cases, Cluster sampling helps to analyze the data efficiently.

Let, you are dealing with coronavirus cases. You need to analyze the data of the whole world. Moreover, there is no central data center by which you can get data from the whole world. Now, you need to collect data on coronavirus cases from individual countries’ websites. It may take a couple of months to collect data from all the countries of the world. And it is impractical. With such type of case, you need to select some countries randomly, considering a country as a cluster. Now, your task is to collect data from those selected countries. Such type of sampling is known as Cluster Sampling.
Don’t get worried, you are on the right track. we just gave a few examples of sampling. You might think, what is the need for the idea of sampling as you can do a better job by population.

Let’s assume, you are working as a data scientist in a multinational company where there is a database of billions of customers’ transactions. Your boss asks you to find out the customer category according to the transaction. Applying proper sampling techniques, you can easily find out your desire result.
You may also come across a situation where the use of API is limited and you need to create an analysis model for the whole system. In these cases, you are forced to sample.
There are also so many cases where sampling is a must in data science.
Sampling is a huge topic in statistics. Discussing all of them is beyond the scope of the article.
If you are interested to know more about sampling, get rushed to the following link;
Though we have learned very few topics of sampling, it hopefully covers the knowledge needed to implement a statistical model of data science.
“Intellectually, they knew a great deal. Practically, they chose to know almost nothing” — Peter Benchley

So, now try to do some practice. It will give you a hands-on experience. Recently Dataset of coronavirus has been published. Download the dataset from Kaggle. There area 6 datasets in total. I would like to suggest the covid_19_data.csv file to analyze.

In practice, statistical analysis depends on the population and sample. With a broad view, sampling is used to infer the characteristics of the entire area of the population. Most of the cases, the entire area (population) is so vast and an optimum sample can do a great deal with that case.
By analyzing a sample, we try to describe a population. Plotting helps us to get a visual impact on the description.
The prediction model (Machine learning, etc.) can also be created based on the sample.
